main_definition: Family refers to a group of people related by blood, marriage, or adoption, often living together in one household.

meanings_and_examples.example: John's mother and father are his immediate biological family.
Sarah and James have three kids; they make up the core of their extended family.
Emily's husband, David, has a sister named Rachel who is part of his family now.
The Smith family includes two children that were adopted by the Johnsons. They are not related by blood but are considered as their own family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Extended family (including grandparents, aunts, uncles, cousins)
meanings_and_examples.example: Every Sunday afternoon, Lucy's whole extended family gets together for a big dinner and catch-up session.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collective of individuals bound by shared values or beliefs
meanings_and_examples.example: The Smiths are not related but consider themselves as one big 'family', having been brought up in the same community with similar customs.
